definition: to be dead/not to be, or cease to exist
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly

sentences.english: They continue their cat-and-mouse game for a seemingly inter-minable period of time.
sentences.chinese: 他们似乎没完没了地玩着这个猫捉老鼠的游戏。

sentences.english: And it would appear that there isn’t an end in sight to these Twitter clones.
sentences.chinese: 并且这是Twitter的克隆品似乎是没完没了。

sentences.english: All this endless bad news browns me off.
sentences.chinese: 这没完没了的坏消息烦死我了。

sentences.english: It's endless work maintaining the building in good repair.
sentences.chinese: 要维持这座大楼完好无损真是个没完没了的活。

sentences.english: I must pull in, or my letter will never end.
sentences.chinese: 我必须限制住，要不我这封信就会写个没完没了。

sentences.english: The man cannot be borne or ultimate inexorable woman chatters perpetually.
sentences.chinese: 男人不能忍受或者根本听不进女人没完没了的唠叨。

sentences.english: There seems to be no end to research on teaching methods.
sentences.chinese: 针对教学方法的研究好像没完没了。

sentences.english: She was wearied by the constant noise.
sentences.chinese: 她很厌烦那些没完没了的噪杂声。

sentences.english: She's always going on about her various problems.
sentences.chinese: 她总是没完没了地诉说她的各种问题。

sentences.english: Then he would write to you, and there'd never be an end of it.
sentences.chinese: 这样他又要写信给你，那可就永远没完没了啦。

sentences.english: Once the story got abroad, I would never hear the last of it.
sentences.chinese: 要是这个奇闻一旦传了出去，就会讨论个没完没了。

sentences.english: Nagging serves no useful purpose for preventing puppy love.
sentences.chinese: 没完没了的说教对于防止孩子们早恋毫无用处。

sentences.english: Perhaps the endless interrogation he is now undergoing will tell.
sentences.chinese: 他正在接受的没完没了的审讯或许会告诉我们。

sentences.english: The two women gabbed away twenty to the dozen.
sentences.chinese: 那两个女人叽里咕噜说个没完没了。

sentences.english: The two women gabbled away twenty to the dozen.
sentences.chinese: 那两个女人叽里咕噜说个没完没了。

sentences.english: The dull play seemed to last an eternity.
sentences.chinese: 这场无聊的戏似乎演个没完没了。

definition: to be finished/to be done for/ruined/gone to the dogs/oh no
to have disappeared/to be missing/nowhere to be found
in a short while/all at once/all of a sudden
I've got a solution!/to have a bun in the oven (abbr. for 有了胎[you3 le5 tai1])
that/those/then (in that case)/commonly pr. [nei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing
hey!/(interjection used to attract attention or to express surprise or disapprobation)
at a loss/unable to do anything about it/to have no choice
